newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada 1996/97 crop production estimates - official.
newsitem.headline: Canada 1996/97 crop production estimates - official.

text.p: Canadian farmers estimated they will produce the following amounts of crops in the 1996/97 crop year, ending next July 31, according to a poll done by Statistics Canada.
The Statistics Canada survey was conducted from September 9 to September 16.
Statistics Canada said barley production in the 1996/97 crop year was expected to be the highest on record, reaching 735 million bushels.
That resulted from an increase of 1.6 million seeded acres and record yields in Saskatchewan.
"In spite of the cool, wet harvest weather in many regions, farmers continued to report above average yields," the agency said.
But it also said the survey was taken when the harvest was about half completed, so bad weather may still change expected yields before the harvest is completed.
Total wheat production was expected to be 177 million bushels more than last year, due to higher yields and a 15 percent increase in seeded acreage, the agency said.
"The driving force behind the increase in seeded acreage was the high grain prices forecast as a result of tightening global supplies," Statistics Canada said.
(For more information from Statistics Canada, contact its Agriculture Division: Dave Burroughs at (613) 951-5138 or Tony Dupuis at (613) 951-5138.)
